heading: oracle enjoys huge profit hike
subheading: oracle said its profits jumped 40 percent in the second quarter, amid heightened demand for its products coupled with cost-cutting moves.
author: reuters
text: database software maker oracle tuesday said second-quarter profits leaped 40 percent as demand grew for business networks and it benefited from a cost-cutting plan. the redwood shores, california-based company said profits for the three months ended 30 november rose to us$384 million, or 26 cents a share, compared with $274 million, or 19 cents, a year earlier.the wall street consensus estimate was 22 cents a share, according to first call/thomson financial, which tracks estimates.oracle said total software license revenues in the period rose 18 percent over last year. sales of its core database software rose 17 percent to $651 million, while applications software sales jumped 31 percent to $168 million.meanwhile, service revenues gained 10 percent to $1.4 billion, it said."the growth of corporate intranets and the world wide web is driving demand for both the oracle8i database and our applications," oracle chief executive larry ellison said. "our early commitment to internet computing has enabled us to extend our lead in world database market share."oracle also made progress toward its goal, set six months ago, of trimming $1 billion from costs within two years, chief financial officer jeff henley said.copyright
